lines.gurmukhi: AvGit auqir srovir mjnu krY jpq Ajpw jwpu AnBY AiBAwsI hY
lines.transliteration_english: Avaghati Outari Sarovari Majanu Karai , Japat Ajapaa Jaapu Anabhai Abhiaasee Hai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: Crossing the difficult discipline of the Yogi; a Guru-oriented person bathes himself in the mystical tenth door of the spiritual realm. He dwells in the elixir-like Naam and becomes practitioner of fearless Lord.

lines.gurmukhi: inJr Apwr Dwr brKw Akws bws jgmg joiq Anhd AibnwsI hY
lines.transliteration_english: Nijhar Apaar Dhaar Barakhaa Akaas Baasa , Jagamag Joti Anahad Abinaasee Hai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: He experiences a continuous flow of the celestial nectar in the mystical tenth opening. He experiences light divine and continuous playing of celestial unstruck melody.

lines.gurmukhi: Awqm Avys prmwqm p√çys kY ADXwqm igAwn iriD isiD iniD dwsI hY
lines.transliteration_english: Aatam Avays Paramaatam Pravays Kai , Adhayaatam Giaan Ridhi Sidhi Nidhi Daasee Hai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: A Guru-oriented person settles in self and gets absorbed in the Lord God. By virtue of his spiritual knowledge all the miraculous powers now become his slaves.

lines.gurmukhi: jIvn mukiq jgjIvn jugiq jwnI sill kml giq mwieAw mY audwsI hY ]248]
lines.transliteration_english: Jeevan Moukati Jagajeevan Jougati Jaanee , Salil Kamal Gati Maaiaa Mai Udaasee Hai ?248?

Shabad OS B.translation: One, who, in this life has learnt the means of reaching the Lord is liberated while still alive. He remains unaffected by worldly matters (maya), like a lotus flower that lives in water and is not affected by it. (248)
